column4: Question: I am trying to use the Terminal Service Client to control an XP machine, the XP machine has a static IP, port forwarding set up and allows remote connections. However when I try to connect I get  a 'connection refused' error. What could be wrong and how do I fix it?
is the xp machine behind a firewall?
I disabled the machines XP firewall completely.
are you doing so across a LAN?
No, over the internet.
so the xp box is connected directly without a firewall?
i mean, firewall/router
verify your port forwarding on the router
I have comfirmed the port forwarding set up, I followed the guide on http://portforward.com/routers.htm
if you still cant get it to work, maybe try another port... never know what the ISP might be blocking
are you trying to find the ip of your xp box remotely?
No, I am trying to test connecting to another computer outside my lan.
did you try changing the port?
I am trying to find a guide online that will help me change the port, I am not sure how to do it.
you should be able to set the external port to whatever you want, and just keep the internal port the same
on your router
Would I do this on the XP box, the target of the Terminal SErver client?
on the firewall, change the port on the internet side to a different port, then connect with the different port through the terminal client on your ubuntu box
How do I change the port on my TSC?
try this:  ipaddress:port
I am a bit of a newbie when it comes to net problems, I am unable to ping the target XP box with either my linux box or my vista box. I think that is a problem for the TSC, yes?
it seems to me that the key of your problem is the router.  try connecting the xp box directly to the internet to see if it is really your router setup or not
I will try that.
np, but i suggest you try to adjust your router to get it to work, its crazy to connect any version of windows to the internet directly!
